trans-unit.source: How to: Change the Connection Mode
trans-unit.target: How to: Change the Connection Mode

trans-unit.source: The connection mode defines how a <token>sb2</token> application connects to other applications when it uses a TCP connection: either <newTerm>Relayed</newTerm> or <newTerm>Hybrid</newTerm>:
trans-unit.target: The connection mode defines how a <token>sb2</token> application connects to other applications when it uses a TCP connection: either <newTerm>Relayed</newTerm> or <newTerm>Hybrid</newTerm>:

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Relayed</codeEntityReference> – all communications between the service and client applications use <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Relayed</codeEntityReference> – all communications between the service and client applications use <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Hybrid</codeEntityReference> – the initial connection between the applications uses <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Hybrid</codeEntityReference> – the initial connection between the applications uses <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: However, if the two applications can connect to each other, they will attempt to do this.
trans-unit.target: However, if the two applications can connect to each other, they will attempt to do this.

trans-unit.source: If at any time this connection is lost, the applications will revert to communicating through <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: If at any time this connection is lost, the applications will revert to communicating through <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: The connection mode is defined by the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode</codeEntityReference> enumeration, which is in turn used by <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> to define the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding.
trans-unit.target: The connection mode is defined by the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode</codeEntityReference> enumeration, which is in turn used by <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> to define the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you can set the connection mode for a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding by setting the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBindingBase.ConnectionMode</codeEntityReference> property.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you can set the connection mode for a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding by setting the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBindingBase.ConnectionMode</codeEntityReference> property.

trans-unit.source: You can do this at any time in your application: <token>sb2</token> will take the change and attempt to modify the connection.
trans-unit.target: You can do this at any time in your application: <token>sb2</token> will take the change and attempt to modify the connection.

trans-unit.source: As with most properties, you can decide to set the connection status in the App.config file.
trans-unit.target: As with most properties, you can decide to set the connection status in the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: Finally, <token>sb2</token> exposes the current status of the connection through the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.IHybridConnectionStatus</codeEntityReference> interface, which you can decide to implement.
trans-unit.target: Finally, <token>sb2</token> exposes the current status of the connection through the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.IHybridConnectionStatus</codeEntityReference> interface, which you can decide to implement.

trans-unit.source: The following topic describes how to determine or modify the mode of a <token>sb2</token> application.
trans-unit.target: The following topic describes how to determine or modify the mode of a <token>sb2</token> application.

trans-unit.source: To modify the connection mode programmatically
trans-unit.target: To modify the connection mode programmatically

trans-unit.source: Create the binding, and then set the property.
trans-unit.target: Create the binding, and then set the property.

trans-unit.source: To modify the connection mode with an App.config file
trans-unit.target: To modify the connection mode with an App.config file

trans-unit.source: Open the application configuration file for the client application, as in the following example.
trans-unit.target: Open the application configuration file for the client application, as in the following example.

trans-unit.source: Note that the <codeInline>netTcpRelayBinding</codeInline> tag does not specify the connection mode attribute.
trans-unit.target: Note that the <codeInline>netTcpRelayBinding</codeInline> tag does not specify the connection mode attribute.

trans-unit.source: By default, the connection mode used is <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Relayed</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: By default, the connection mode used is <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Relayed</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: Explicitly change the connection mode to <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Hybrid</codeEntityReference> by adding the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBindingBase.ConnectionMode</codeEntityReference> field, which is set to <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Hybrid</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: Explicitly change the connection mode to <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Hybrid</codeEntityReference> by adding the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">P:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NetTcpRelayBindingBase.ConnectionMode</codeEntityReference> field, which is set to <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Hybrid</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: To determine when the connection mode changes
trans-unit.target: To determine when the connection mode changes

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you might want to receive a notification when the connection between the connected endpoints changes from a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Relayed</codeEntityReference> connection to a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Hybrid</codeEntityReference> connection.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you might want to receive a notification when the connection between the connected endpoints changes from a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Relayed</codeEntityReference> connection to a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayConnectionMode.Hybrid</codeEntityReference> connection.
